>Again, I think there is some misunderstanding.

ink Eugene is referring to the scenario where your TestCase is created

a suite and is passed parameters in its constructor.

t method with the default value, not the one with the

>=
As I said, it's a problem that is independent of the testing framework you
=
>use (and I actually have figured out a way for the TestNG Eclipse plug-in =
to
>directly use a @DataProvider for that, so that all you need to do is to=

  I see no issies to resolve the rig=
ht test case even in JUnit3 runner. 
Basically you can find out that parent=
 suite is TestSuite and UI should

cted for re-run, then it will be 
matter to get a result Test instance from=
